New Records: Chicago White Sox set franchise record with 107th loss
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched two-hit ball over seven innings
Francisco Lindor belted his 29th home run
Starling Marte drove an RBI double in the ninth
Crochet (6-10) tied an American League record by striking out the first seven batters and whiffed eight in all over 3 1/3 innings
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of keeping intensity and staying locked in
Manager Grady Sizemore said there's a chance 3B Yo√°n Moncada (adductor strain) will rejoin the team during the six-game trip to Baltimore and Boston
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's ability to win one day at a time
Manager Grady Sizemore said Crochet was on, he had good stuff, but was frustrated with the short leash and pitch count
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets squeezed out their fourth straight win and ninth in 13 games
The White Sox completed the first 0-10 homestand in franchise history
The Mets pulled within a game of Atlanta for the final NL wild card when the Braves lost 3-2 at Philadelphia in 11 innings
Others: The White Sox are limiting Crochet's workload because he missed most of the past two seasons following Tommy John surgery and was a reliever before that
The White Sox have lost 12 straight games at Guaranteed Rate Field, equaling a season high
